headline: Goulash Supreme
description: Whether you call it goulash or chili mac, this weeknight skillet supper is easy and delicious.

video.description: Macaroni cooks with ground beef and onions in a spicy tomato sauce.
video.name: Goulash Supreme

name: Goulash Supreme

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add ground beef; cook and stir until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.

Reduce heat to low. Add stewed tomatoes, macaroni, onion, garlic, chili powder, and paprika; mix well. Stir in tomato paste. Simmer, adding a little water as needed if the mixture gets too dry, until macaroni is tender, about 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Great!!

So, I have a family of 7. I’m rating the way I cooked it. For my family: 2 lbs elbow noodles cooked 2 lbs beef 2 lbs bob Evans sausage 2 red peppers (bell) 2 medium or one large onion One bunch of minced garlic 4 cans tomatoes with chilis 1 cup of water 2 tsp Hungarian paprika 1 stick of butter Salt and pepper to taste Chili powder A dash of worcheshire sauce And sharp cheddar cheese Brown the beef. This is critical, for taste. In separate pan brown the onion and garlic in the butter and when clearish and soft add the peppers. When all is soft add to the noodles and the cans of tomatoes and add the water. Legit add all the spices and let simmer for a few hours mixing occasionally. The water added will keep it from burning . Everyone loved it
Good base recipe to add leftover veggies to like carrot, corn, green pepper, mushroom etc.

I did as many other did and cooked the noodles first then put them into cold water to stop them from over cooking and becoming mush. I used ground turkey meat because that’s what I had in my freezer and was out of hamburger. Only other thing I did was add a can of diced tomatoes, and also used a can of stewed tomatoes and I added a can of rinsed dark red kidney beans because I remember my grandmother’s having them. I enjoyed it on this cold and wet afternoon here.
Probably will not make this again. Not much flavor to it.

I added some celery salt, oregano leaves, parsley flakes, green onions, garlic powder, Del Monte Ketchup for tangy taste, half a cup of Ortega Mild Salsa to add some mild heat. (Ortega Diced Green Chilies can be add an additional zest as well). Garnished with a mix of Cheddar & Monterey cheese, additional green onions & fresh cilantro leaves optional. Serve with Texas Garlic Toast or Texas Cheese Toast. My Family Enjoyed It!
My goulash was delicious! I did add fire right stead tomatoes and paprika . Also I added worstershire to the meat while cooking and a small amount of chili powder for a little bite !
My family really enjoyed this dish. The only change I made was using gluten free pasta and ground pork

this recipe tastes good, but the instructions need some revising... it's clear you need to cook the macaroni separately. seriously. it needs to be SEPARATE. Also could use a bit more water. I tried adding a tablespoon at a time and had minimal luck. it tastes great, but it's an insanely thick mess. I'll give it a 3 for now until I can try it done correctly.
I did as some of the others and cooked my noodles separate. This was more like a chili mac than goulash. Way too much tomato taste and chili powder.
This is so good. I added a can of chili beans and used rotini past because i didn't have enough elbow macaroni. Served with cornbread.

Great recipe. I made it according to the original recipe and it was quick and easy. We like spicy foods so the next time I used hot Italian sausage, hot Mexican chili powder. For fun we put in some peperoni and celery and loved it! Thank you for a great base recipe!
Family loved it, will make again
I cook the macaroni separate so the goulash does not have the pasty taste.
This tastes just like the goulash that my mother made when I was growing up. It's perfect!
I left out the chili powder because of diet restrictions. It was excellent, my husband loved it. Next time I'll try adding mushrooms just to change it up a little.
Cook the pasta separately

Was super easy! Cooked noodles separately. I browned ground beef, onion & garlic together then added cooked noodles and everything thing else. I did use tomato paste and added close to 20 oz of water so because it was kinda thick. 10 year old loved it.
Turned out fine. Family liked it. I will make again for sure

First time I followed the recipe...pretty good though missing some things. Second time I added onion, carrots, celery and a few artichoke hearts. I added some unsalted chicken stock and pasta to cook in the soup. Both times I used a mixture of ground chicken/pork since I don't eat beef.
Easy to make for dinner. Family love it.
Didn't have a lot of taste. Bland. I will look for another recipe. Keep trying as they say.
Yes, made changes based on reviews. Added bell pepper & Worcestershire , cooked Mac separate. Hubby loved it, eating it cold out of frig!
I made it exactly as the recipe directed and it turned out to be a fav in this household.
Replaced the stewed tomatoes with Rot-el Diced Tomatoes and & Chopped Green Chiles (you chose the spicy heat)
I added more water but it should be cooked on a lower heat. I would make it again.
Go-To-Goulash! Love it. Been making for years since I found it while looking for a similar one to my aunts. It is my go-to-goulash!
I made this. Only used 2 Cans stead tomatoes. Can of water. Added corn. Very good!
I took the other testers advice and cooked the pasta separate p

one of my favorite dishes! my mom taught me when I was little! I put ground beef, potatoes, fresh garlic, and garlic powder, onion, carrots, cilantro, basil and corn!! topped it off with cheese and butter bread on the side! my family loves it! dont be afraid to get creative!!
Added crushed tomatoes for more liquid, turned out great! Will definitely make it again!
It was a little bland. I will make it again but may add some bell pepper
I added corn, worcestershire sauce and cheese. This is the best Goulash I've made in years! I will definately make it again.

My late mother often made this dish when I was a kid, but she called it "Lob Lolly". It was fairly economical and she didn't have to use a lot of expensive beef that way. I made it for my own family and have passed the recipe down to my sons and their families. The great thing about this dish is it can be tweaked a LOT to suit individual tastes. With salad and garlic bread, it's a neat little meal.

This a great recipe! Something that you can put together after work. Next time I think I will leave out the tomato paste and add bell pepper. Also, it will be better if the macaroni is cooked just a little before mixing it in with the other ingredients.
Quick and easy. Delicious and perfect for a winters’ night.

I did not use the tomato paste or the quart of stewed tomatoes. I used prego traditional sauce and prego jar of water. I also used 1 can of fire roasted tomatoes and added green peppers. Didn't have garlic cloves so I used garlic powder. I will definitely make again.
I already submitted an excellent review but I forgot the one change that I did that many others did. Definitely cook the pasta separate.

This is a solid one-pot supper dish. For modifications, I substituted one pound chopped kielbasa for the ground beef, added a medium bell pepper (chopped), 1/4 cup red wine, 3 tblsp sugar and 1 tsp garlic powder. For tomatoes, I used 3 14-oz cans chopped tomatoes (including liquid) and omitted the paste. I ended up adding about 3/4 cup water while the macaroni cooked on medium high heat, which took about 15 mins. I like the combination of chili powder and paprika with the other flavors. I will make this again, and I will probably cut pasta to one cup and add in some garbanzo or kidney beans for more fiber/texture. Tasty, quick & easy!
After making it my husband and I had to add more salt and pepper as we found those lacking. I will definitely make it again.
Al liked this one
It was really good! I browned my meat separately and added to sauce, also added corn kernels. My family loved it! But no pic sorry!

bla... not enough spice
and I cooked the pasta separate and added later

bla... not enough spice
and I cooked the pasta separate and added later
I used green ROTEL and kinda warmed it up but overall GOOD!!!
We loved this dish. I cooked the macaroni separately, but everything else as directed.
I added a T. sugar to take out the very acidic taste. That helped but I still felt that it was missing something. Maybe just the green pepper. It definitely is a man's dish.

I’m not one to alter recipes as I’m not confident enough to do that. With that being said, I thought this recipe was pretty boring. It lacks a lot of flavor. I used salt and pepper at the table. My husband sprinkled on some Parmesan. I probably won’t make it again. Disappointed ??
I was very happy with it! I had to reduce the amount of paprika and chili powder to accommodate a couple of spice wimps in the house, but otherwise I wouldn’t change anything!

I had to add red hot peppers, brown sugar, oregano, basil, smoked paprika, lots of salt, garlic powder, garlic salt, ketchup, chicken broth, worchestire, soy sauce, Italian seasoning. totally scrumptious. now delicious.

First time try I follow the recipe exactly. Hubs and son in law loved it . Hubby asked if next time I would put his corn back in., I’ll be adding that in. Thanks Cheryl for a Great Recipe easy to make and delicious beside. Win! win!

I couldn't wait to try this recipe as it could not have been simpler to make. I made a couple of changes by using the Italian style stewed tomatoes that included garlic and oregano and I chopped up an orange bell pepper instead of the green (to avoid heartburn) Did not use tomato paste as I did not have any but added about a half a cup of spaghetti sauce. For the add'l water I added beef broth instead..it was delicious. I didn't have any special rolls but remembered that I had frozen garlic bread which was perfect! Love that it was plenty for another meal for the 2 of us!
It was okay but it didn't taste like I was used to

I don't know if I remember goulash being different or if what my mom called goulash was not goulash. What I remember was her cutting a beef roast in to cubes, browning it, cooking it in a brown gravy, and serving it over egg noodles. 

I found this recipe to be kind of bland and it reminded me more of chili with macaroni noodles mixed in.

I made the following changes to the recipe: after draining the grease from the cooked ground meat I sauteed the onions and some chopped red pepper with the meat. I added a 1/4 cup of white wine to deglaze the pot. Along with the other ingredients I added a tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce and half a bag of frozen peas and carrots. 

As was stated in other reviews, in the future I will cook the pasta separately then add it to the completed sauce. By adding the uncooked pasta to the sauce, I ended up with a gooey mess of "almost" pasta. This is the main reason I didn't rate the recipe higher. I might also consider cooking the peas and carrots first before adding them to the sauce.
Different take on a regular goulash that had nice flavor with the listed spices. I did parboil my pasta first as I didn't have much time before dinner. I would make this again absolutely!
I will make it again. Very good!
So easy and tasty! My husband loved it, served it with Texas toast
Had to add some more water, was OK, but probably won’t make it again.

Super good and will definitely make it again! I didn't have paprika so I added Worcestershire sauce, more chili powder, salt and peper, and some ground cumin. Also added shredded cheese on top towards the end. And I had to add some water to help the noodles soften up. But my fiance and I loved it! ??
Decent evening meal. Added green pepper
I added some jalapenos and this stuff is good.
Love the stewed tomatoes in this. Served it with French bread.
We really enjoyed this easy to make dinner tonight.
love goulash i used regular tomatoes and a little red pepper flakes so good!!!
My husband and I love this dish and will be making it again
pic shows a green ingredient which i'm guessing is green pepper. not in the recipe. hmmmm. hate when that happens. what else is missing?
Used diced tomatoes and added seasonings that my family likes. I will make this again!
First time making Goulash, and it was delicious! Definitely wanted seconds. I didn't use chili powder or tomato paste, and added in a diced green pepper.
Made no changes and it was great and will make again.
used ground turkey, was great!

I will start with ALWAYS cook your macaroni separately. This is a basic recipe for goulash. My mother cooked this as I grew up learning how to cook from her. 
I saute my ground beef, onions, and green bell pepper together. 
Drain the grease off after the beef has browned and the onions and bell peppers have softened. 
Add spices 1 tbs chili powder, 1/4 tsp garlic powder, 1/2 tsp salt..stir until well blended, then add 1 can stewed tomatoes and 1 can tomatoes sauce. After your macaroni has cooked separately in boiling water for about 5 to 7 minutes, drain well...rinse then put into the meat and tomato mixture and let cook medium heat for 20 minutes stirring occasionally.

We like this with a few added changes
Worcestershire sauce 
Dash or two of hot sauce 
Garlic & Lemon pepper 
Ketchup
Frozen corn
We put this on fresh made buttered bread like a sandwich super yummy

This is yummy but as someone who comes from a Hungarian family, I have no idea why Americans call ground beef and macaroni “goulash” (gulasz). Goulash is much more like a beef stew with chunks of beef, browned and simmered in its own sauce (add liquid, of course, after the browning). As you can tell, this has been a pet peeve of mine for decades!??
I also add a can of green beans and a can of corn. I also add mushrooms, celery. To top it all off a Caesar salad and garlic bread
Delicious!
Delicious!
Very good but I added green pepper since it's in the picture of this dish. I guess they forgot to put it in the ingredients...

I have made this a long time and just wanted to add using the Stewed Tomatoes with peppers and onions gives it more flavor. Also add a pinch of sugar to bring down the acidic taste. My kids and my family loved this for years.
Good stuff! I added green peppers, but otherwise followed the recipe. Quick and easy to make, and very tasty..

I did make a change and used tomatoes with chili peppers to give it a little ump! and also didn't use tomato paste but used an Italian sauce. It was a big hit with the husband. He said it brought back memories of his childhood that he missed with his aunt's awesome cooking in Texas.
This goulash has good flavor but I had to add 2 cups of water? I made it as directed and I used the optional 6oz tomato paste. Be careful. Noodles absorb a lot of liquid.

Too bland for my family's taste. Needed a lot more spices for us. I returned to AllRecipes and found "Classic Goulash and added the ingredients from the Classic Goulash recipe. It was more to our taste. Next time I'll prepare just the Classic Goulash recipe and then I can give it a true rating.

This was great! I only had 2 eating in my home so I halved the recipe. I added a little worshishire sauce, a little cumin and a little brown sugar (I always add brow sugar to my tomato-based dishes). Mine did not turn out gooey as some reviewer's had. You just have to make sure the meat mixture has enough water in it(1& 1/2 cups) and that it is at a rolling boil before you add the pasta. I had another small pot of water boiling on the stove just in case I needed to add more water, which I did have to add (1 more cup). I had enough leftovers for another 2 servings. It turned out perfect! Thank you for sharing!
Like others, I cooked elbow macaroni separately. I used garden tomatoes & bell peppers because we had an abundance in the garden. It’s always a favorite & a quick meal to prepare.
good as always, its my go to for an easy meal

Delicious! Very family friendly! The only change I made was that I cooked the pasta separately and then mixed them together! Yummy comfort food on a chilly night! My family asked if I would make it again and I will!
not m y idea of supreme.. will keep looking..ty for sharing
do not add tomato paste!
no changes

This recipe makes a lot. I cut it back by using 1/2 pound ground beef and 751ml can of crushed tomatoes and it still made enough for 4-6 people. Other reviews suggested cooking the pasta separately, which I did. Just make sure that the meat sauce is to the thickness you desire and then add the el dente pasta, mix and serve. I also added hot sauce for kick and Parmesan cheese once plated. Good and easy!!!

This was good. I substituted the stewed tomatoes for a can of fire roasted diced tomatoes and a can of diced tomatoes with Italian seasoning. I used tomato sauce instead of paste. Liked many others I cooked my macaroni first. It all came together very well and husband loved it.
Good recipe - but try adding a can of corn kernels! Mmmmmm

I made this pretty much per the recipe. It was ok. The only real change, I knew it would have to have more water and I added at least a cup right at the start. You don't have to cook the pasta seperate, you just have to taste it until its done on a lower temperature. 
 Really this recipe shouldn't have the stars it has, folks make their changes and rate the outcome per their changes. I think the person who submitted it should have been more detailed. One would certainly wonder, am I really supposed to add the pasta without cooking it. Take the time to be specific. What other details are left out?
This was real good. I think I will add more spices next time. But Hubby and son really liked it. Thanks

I never follow a recipe to fidelity! I read lots of reviews and then created my own version. I cooked my pasta separately. I used diced tomatoes, Worchestershire sauce, seasoned pepper, beef bouillon, smoked Hungarian Paprika, and garlic powder. The hubs doesn't like spicy so I left that out. I also gave some to my custodians at school with some artisan bread and they loved it! Perfect comfort food!

Oh come on! This is the most basic, bland "goulash" recipe I have ever seen here. Yet this site won't publish some recipes because there are all ready too many similar ones when you try to submit one? Seriously? No offense to the submitter, but this is really a basic recipe most cooks have doctored up to make it better.
Perfect for a January night.
This was delicious! I used diced tomatoes and omitted the paprika and chili powder.
